meanings.definition: Burned or seared with a hot iron or caustic substance to stop bleeding or prevent infection.
meanings.sent1: The cauterised wound quickly healed without any complications.
meanings.sent2: The doctor used a cauterised tool to seal the wound.
meanings.sent3: The cauterised area smelled like burnt hair, making everyone wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent4: Her cauterised fingertips felt like they had touched a scorching hot pan.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cauterised wound left a lasting impression on his mind.

meanings.definition: To burn or sear with a hot iron or caustic substance to stop bleeding or prevent infection.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon cauterised the blood vessels to stop the bleeding during the operation.
meanings.sent2: He cauterised the wound carefully to prevent any infections.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally cauterised the edge of the cutting board, leaving a black mark.
meanings.sent4: Her words cauterised his heart, leaving him feeling numb.
meanings.sent5: The idea of cauterising the wound made him cringe, but he knew it was necessary.
